A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: While the movie has some beautiful scenes\, the writing and overall plot end up retroactively weakening episode 7 and leaving little hope for episode 9. Plot lines from 7 are subverted for the sake of being subverted\, others are dropped entirely. Rather than replacing them with equally interesting plot\, ep 8 replaces them with a boring grind of a storyline that moves at a snails pace. Ultimately nothing new is created\, and everything old is destroyed leaving episode 9 to work with scraps. As a self-contained movie\, episode 8 is riddled with plot holes\, useless subplots\, cringey dialogue and scenes\, strange pacing\, and writing that ends up creating moronic situations which any fool with half a brain cell could have solved. Rian Johnson has completely failed Star Wars fans and casuals alike.
